Package com.rapidminer.belt.column

Class ColumnTypes

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.column.ColumnTypes
  • public final class ColumnTypes
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to create ColumnTypes. Columns types of the categories Column.Category.CATEGORICAL and Column.Category.OBJECT can be created using the categoricalType(String, Class, Comparator) and objectType(String, Class, Comparator) methods respectively. Column types for builtin formats are predefined, e.g., NOMINAL.
    Author:
    Michael Knopgf

      Complex id for categorical columns with String values.

      Complex id for real columns without complex values.
      static ColumnType<java.time.LocalTime> TIME
      Complex id for time columns.

    • Method Detail

      • categoricalType

        public static <T> ColumnType<T> categoricalType​(java.lang.String customTypeId,
                                                java.lang.Class<T> elementType,
                                                java.util.Comparator<T> comparator)
        Returns a new categorical type with the given id, element type and comparator (optional). The id must be unique and should follow Java's naming convention for packages. Belt assumes that the given element type is immutable, i.e., that is is safe to share instances between tables.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type
        Parameters:
        customTypeId - the id of the custom type
        elementType - the immutable element type
        comparator - the comparator (optional)
        Returns:
        the complex custom types
        See Also:
        Column.Category.CATEGORICAL

      • objectType

        public static <T> ColumnType<T> objectType​(java.lang.String customTypeId,
                                           java.lang.Class<T> elementType,
                                           java.util.Comparator<T> comparator)
        Returns a new object type with the given id, element type and comparator (optional). The id must be unique and should follow Java's naming convention for packages. Belt assumes that the given element type is immutable, i.e., that is is safe to share instances between tables.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type
        Parameters:
        customTypeId - the id of the custom type
        elementType - the immutable element type
        comparator - the comparator (optional)
        Returns:
        the complex custom type
        See Also:
        Column.Category.OBJECT
